1823def t1_hypointensity( x, xsegmentation, xWMProbability, template, templateWMPrior, wmh_thresh=0.1 ):
1824    """
1825    provide measurements that may help decide if a given t1 image is likely
1826    to have hypointensity.
1827
1828    x: input image; bias-corrected, brain-extracted and denoised
1829
1830    xsegmentation: input image hard-segmentation results
1831
1832    xWMProbability: input image WM probability
1833
1834    template: template image
1835
1836    templateWMPrior: template tissue prior
1837
1838    wmh_thresh: float used to threshold WMH probability and produce summary data
1839
1840    returns:
1841
1842        - wmh_summary: summary data frame based on thresholding WMH probability at wmh_thresh
1843        - wmh_probability_image: probability image denoting WMH probability; higher values indicate
1844          that WMH is more likely
1845        - wmh_evidence_of_existence: an integral evidence that indicates the likelihood that the input
1846            image content supports the presence of white matter hypointensity.
1847            greater than zero is supportive of WMH.  the higher, the more so.
1848            less than zero is evidence against.
1849        - wmh_max_prob: max probability of wmh
1850        - features: the features driving WMH predictons
1851
1852    """
1853
1854    if False: # Need to retrain this model with refined inference code
1855        return {
1856            "wmh_summary":None,
1857            "wmh_probability_image":None,
1858            "wmh_evidence_of_existence":None,
1859            "wmh_max_prob":None,
1860            "features":None }
1861
1862    mybig = [88,128,128]
1863    templatesmall = ants.resample_image( template, mybig, use_voxels=True )
1864    qaff = ants.registration(
1865        ants.rank_intensity(x),
1866        ants.rank_intensity(templatesmall), 'antsRegistrationSyNQuickRepro[s]',
1867        syn_sampling=2,
1868        syn_metric='CC',
1869        reg_iterations = [25,15,0,0],total_sigma=0.5,
1870        aff_metric='GC', random_seed=1 )
1871    afftx = qaff['fwdtransforms'][1]
1872    templateWMPrior2x = ants.apply_transforms( x, templateWMPrior, qaff['fwdtransforms'] )
1873    cerebrum = ants.threshold_image( xsegmentation, 2, 4 )
1874    realWM = ants.threshold_image( templateWMPrior2x , 0.1, math.inf )
1875    inimg = ants.rank_intensity( x )
1876    parcellateWMdnz = ants.kmeans_segmentation( inimg, 2, realWM, mrf=0.3 )['probabilityimages'][0]
1877    x2template = ants.apply_transforms( templatesmall, inimg, afftx, whichtoinvert=[True] )
1878    parcellateWMdnz2template = ants.apply_transforms( templatesmall,
1879      cerebrum * parcellateWMdnz, afftx, whichtoinvert=[True] )
1880    # features = rank+dnz-image, lprob, wprob, wprior at mybig resolution
1881    f1 = x2template.numpy()
1882    f2 = parcellateWMdnz2template.numpy()
1883    f3 = ants.apply_transforms( templatesmall, xWMProbability, afftx, whichtoinvert=[True] ).numpy()
1884    f4 = ants.apply_transforms( templatesmall, templateWMPrior, qaff['fwdtransforms'][0] ).numpy()
1885    myfeatures = np.stack( (f1,f2,f3,f4), axis=3 )
1886    newshape = np.concatenate( [ [1],np.asarray( myfeatures.shape )] )
1887    myfeatures = myfeatures.reshape( newshape )
1888
1889    inshape = [None,None,None,4]
1890    wmhunet = antspynet.create_unet_model_3d( inshape,
1891        number_of_outputs = 1,
1892        number_of_layers = 4,
1893        mode = 'sigmoid' )
1894
1895    wmhunet.load_weights( get_data("simwmhseg", target_extension='.h5') )
1896
1897    pp = wmhunet.predict( myfeatures )
1898
1899    limg = ants.from_numpy( tf.squeeze( pp[0] ).numpy( ) )
1900    limg = ants.copy_image_info( templatesmall, limg )
1901    lesresam = ants.apply_transforms( x, limg, afftx, whichtoinvert=[False] )
1902    # lesresam = lesresam * cerebrum
1903    rnmdl = antspynet.create_resnet_model_3d( inshape,
1904      number_of_outputs = 1,
1905      layers = (1,2,3),
1906      residual_block_schedule = (3,4,6,3), squeeze_and_excite = True,
1907      lowest_resolution = 32, cardinality = 1, mode = "regression" )
1908    rnmdl.load_weights( get_data("simwmdisc", target_extension='.h5' ) )
1909    qq = rnmdl.predict( myfeatures )
1910
1911    lesresamb = ants.threshold_image( lesresam, wmh_thresh, 1.0 )
1912    lgo=ants.label_geometry_measures( lesresamb, lesresam )
1913    wmhsummary = pd.read_csv( get_data("wmh_evidence", target_extension='.csv' ) )
1914    wmhsummary.at[0,'Value']=lgo.at[0,'VolumeInMillimeters']
1915    wmhsummary.at[1,'Value']=lgo.at[0,'IntegratedIntensity']
1916    wmhsummary.at[2,'Value']=float(qq)
1917
1918    return {
1919        "wmh_summary":wmhsummary,
1920        "wmh_probability_image":lesresam,
1921        "wmh_evidence_of_existence":float(qq),
1922        "wmh_max_prob":lesresam.max(),
1923        "features":myfeatures }
1924
1925
1926
1927def deep_nbm( t1,
1928    nbm_weights,
1929    binary_mask=None,
1930    deform=False,
1931    aged_template=False,
1932    csfquantile=None,
1933    reflect=False,
1934    verbose=False ):
1935
1936    """
1937    CH13 and Nucleus basalis of Meynert segmentation and subdivision
1938
1939    Perform CH13 and NBM segmentation in T1 images using Avants labels.
1940
1941    t1 : T1-weighted neuroimage antsImage - already brain extracted
1942
1943    nbm_weights : string weight file for parcellating unet
1944
1945    binary_mask : will restrict output to this mask
1946
1947    deform : boolean to correct for image deformation
1948
1949    aged_template : boolean to control which template to use
1950
1951    csfquantile: if not None, will try to remove CSF from the image.
1952        0.25 may be a good value to try.
1953
1954    verbose: boolean
1955
1956    The labeling is as follows:
1957
1958    Label,Description,Side
1959    1,CH13_left,left
1960    2,CH13_right,right
1961    3,NBM_left_ant,left
1962    4,NBM_left_mid,left
1963    5,NBM_left_pos,left
1964    6,NBM_right_ant,right
1965    7,NBM_right_mid,right
1966    8,NBM_right_pos,right
1967
1968    Failure modes will include odd image orientation (in which case you might
1969    use the registration option).  A more nefarious issue can be a poor extraction
1970    of the cerebrum in the inferior frontal lobe.  These can be unpredictable
1971    but if one sees a bad extraction, please check the mask that is output by
1972    this function to see if it excludes non-cerebral tissue.
1973
1974    """
1975
1976    if not aged_template:
1977        refimg = ants.image_read( get_data( "CIT168_T1w_700um_pad", target_extension='.nii.gz' ))
1978        refimg = ants.rank_intensity( refimg )
1979        refimg = ants.resample_image( refimg, [0.5,0.5,0.5] )
1980        refimgseg = ants.image_read( get_data( "CIT168_basal_forebrain", target_extension='.nii.gz' ))
1981        refimgsmall = ants.resample_image( refimg, [2.0,2.0,2.0] )
1982    else:
1983        refimg = ants.image_read( get_data( "CIT168_T1w_700um_pad_adni", target_extension='.nii.gz' ))
1984        refimg = ants.rank_intensity( refimg )
1985        refimg = ants.resample_image( refimg, [0.5,0.5,0.5] )
1986        refimgseg = ants.image_read( get_data( "CIT168_basal_forebrain_adni", target_extension='.nii.gz' ))
1987        refimgsmall = ants.resample_image( refimg, [2.0,2.0,2.0] )
1988
1989    pt_labels = [1,2,3,4]
1990    group_labels = [0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8]
1991    reflection_labels = [0,2,1,6,7,8,3,4,5]
1992    crop_size = [144,96,64]
1993
1994    def nbmpreprocess( img, pt_labels, group_labels, masker=None, csfquantile=None, returndef=False, reflect=False ):
1995
1996        if masker is None:
1997            imgr = ants.rank_intensity( img )
1998        else:
1999            imgr = ants.rank_intensity( img, mask = masker )
2000
2001        if csfquantile is not None and masker is None:
2002            masker = ants.threshold_image( imgr, np.quantile(imgr[imgr>1e-4], csfquantile ), 1e9 )
2003
2004        if masker is not None:
2005            imgr = imgr * masker
2006
2007        imgrsmall = ants.resample_image( imgr, [1,1,1] )
2008        if not reflect:
2009            reg = ants.registration(
2010                refimgsmall,
2011                imgrsmall,
2012                'antsRegistrationSyNQuickRepro[s]',
2013                reg_iterations = [200,200,20],total_sigma=0.5,
2014                verbose=False )
2015        else:
2016            myref = ants.reflect_image( imgrsmall, axis=0, tx='Translation' )
2017            reg = ants.registration(
2018                refimgsmall,
2019                imgrsmall,
2020                'antsRegistrationSyNQuickRepro[s]',
2021                reg_iterations = [200,200,20],
2022                total_sigma=0.5,
2023                initial_transform = myref['fwdtransforms'][0],
2024                verbose=False )
2025        if not returndef:
2026            imgraff = ants.apply_transforms( refimg, imgr, reg['fwdtransforms'][1], interpolator='linear' )
2027            imgseg = ants.apply_transforms( refimg, refimgseg, reg['invtransforms'][1], interpolator='nearestNeighbor' )
2028        else:
2029            imgraff = ants.apply_transforms( refimg, imgr, reg['fwdtransforms'], interpolator='linear' )
2030            imgseg = ants.image_clone( refimgseg )
2031        binseg = ants.mask_image( imgseg, imgseg, pt_labels, binarize=True )
2032        imgseg = ants.mask_image( imgseg, imgseg, group_labels, binarize=False  )
2033        com = ants.get_center_of_mass( binseg )
2034        return {
2035            "img": imgraff,
2036            "seg": imgseg,
2037            "imgc": special_crop( imgraff, com, crop_size ),
2038            "segc": special_crop( imgseg, com, crop_size ),
2039            "reg" : reg,
2040            "mask": masker
2041            }
2042
2043
2044    nLabels = len( group_labels )
2045    number_of_outputs = len(group_labels)
2046    number_of_channels = 1
2047    ################################################
2048    unet0 = antspynet.create_unet_model_3d(
2049         [ None, None, None, number_of_channels ],
2050         number_of_outputs = 1, # number of landmarks must be known
2051         number_of_layers = 4, # should optimize this wrt criterion
2052         number_of_filters_at_base_layer = 32, # should optimize this wrt criterion
2053         convolution_kernel_size = 3, # maybe should optimize this wrt criterion
2054         deconvolution_kernel_size = 2,
2055         pool_size = 2,
2056         strides = 2,
2057         dropout_rate = 0.0,
2058         weight_decay = 0,
2059         additional_options = "nnUnetActivationStyle",
2060         mode =  "sigmoid" )
2061
2062    unet1 = antspynet.create_unet_model_3d(
2063        [None,None,None,2],
2064        number_of_outputs=number_of_outputs,
2065        mode="classification",
2066        number_of_filters=(32, 64, 96, 128, 256),
2067        convolution_kernel_size=(3, 3, 3),
2068        deconvolution_kernel_size=(2, 2, 2),
2069        dropout_rate=0.0,
2070        weight_decay=0,
2071        additional_options = "nnUnetActivationStyle")
2072
2073    # concat output to input and pass to 2nd net
2074    # nextin = tf.concat(  [ unet0.inputs[0], unet0.outputs[0] ], axis=4 )
2075    import tensorflow as tf
2076    from tensorflow.keras.layers import Layer
2077    class myConcat(Layer):
2078        def call(self, x):
2079            return tf.concat(x, axis=4 )
2080    nextin = myConcat()( [ unet0.inputs[0], unet0.outputs[0] ] )
2081
2082    unetonnet = unet1( nextin )
2083    unet_model = tf.keras.models.Model(
2084            unet0.inputs,
2085            [ unetonnet,  unet0.outputs[0] ] )
2086
2087    unet_model.load_weights( nbm_weights )
2088
2089    imgprepro = nbmpreprocess( t1, pt_labels, group_labels,
2090        csfquantile = csfquantile,
2091        returndef = deform,
2092        reflect = reflect )
2093
2094    def map_back( relo, t1, imgprepro, interpolator='linear', deform = False ):
2095        if not deform:
2096            relo = ants.apply_transforms( t1, relo,
2097                imgprepro['reg']['invtransforms'][0], whichtoinvert=[True],
2098                interpolator=interpolator )
2099        else:
2100            relo = ants.apply_transforms( t1, relo,
2101                imgprepro['reg']['invtransforms'], interpolator=interpolator )
2102        return relo
2103
2104
2105    ####################################################
2106    physspaceBF = imgprepro['imgc']
2107    if verbose:
2108        print( "Mean preprocessed cropped image in nbm seg " + str(physspaceBF.mean() ) )
2109
2110    tfarr1 = tf.cast( physspaceBF.numpy() ,'float32' )
2111    newshapeBF = list( tfarr1.shape )
2112    newshapeBF.insert(0,1)
2113    newshapeBF.insert(4,1)
2114    tfarr1 = tf.reshape(tfarr1, newshapeBF )
2115    snpred = unet_model.predict( tfarr1 )
2116    segpred = snpred[0]
2117    sigmoidpred = snpred[1]
2118    snpred1_image = ants.from_numpy( sigmoidpred[0,:,:,:,0] )
2119    snpred1_image = ants.copy_image_info( physspaceBF, snpred1_image )
2120    snpred1_image = map_back( snpred1_image, t1, imgprepro, 'linear', deform )
2121    bint = ants.threshold_image( snpred1_image, 0.5, 1.0 )
2122    probability_images = []
2123    for jj in range(number_of_outputs-1):
2124        temp = ants.from_numpy( segpred[0,:,:,:,jj+1] )
2125        temp = ants.copy_image_info( physspaceBF, temp )
2126        temp = map_back( temp, t1, imgprepro, 'linear', deform )
2127        probability_images.append( temp )
2128    image_matrix = ants.image_list_to_matrix(probability_images, bint)
2129    segmentation_matrix = (np.argmax(image_matrix, axis=0) + 1)
2130    segmentation_image = ants.matrix_to_images(np.expand_dims(segmentation_matrix, axis=0), bint)[0]
2131    relabeled_image = ants.image_clone(segmentation_image)
2132    if not reflect:
2133        for i in range(1,len(group_labels)):
2134            relabeled_image[segmentation_image==(i)] = group_labels[i]
2135    else:
2136        for i in range(1,len(group_labels)):
2137            relabeled_image[segmentation_image==(i)] = reflection_labels[i]
2138
2139    bfsegdesc = map_segmentation_to_dataframe( 'nbm3CH13', relabeled_image )
2140
2141    return { 'segmentation':relabeled_image,
2142        'description':bfsegdesc,
2143        'mask': imgprepro['mask'],
2144        'probability_images': probability_images }
2145
2146
2147def deep_nbm_old( t1, ch13_weights, nbm_weights, registration=True,
2148    csfquantile = 0.15, binary_mask=None, verbose=False ):
2149
2150    """
2151    Nucleus basalis of Meynert segmentation and subdivision
2152
2153    Perform NBM segmentation in T1 images using Avants labels.
2154
2155    t1 : T1-weighted neuroimage antsImage - already brain extracted
2156
2157    ch13_weights : string weight file for ch13
2158
2159    nbm_weights : string weight file for nbm
2160
2161    registration : boolean to correct for image orientation and resolution by registration
2162
2163    csfquantile : float value below 0.5 that tries to trim residual CSF off brain.
2164
2165    binary_mask : will restrict output to this mask
2166
2167    The labeling is as follows:
2168
2169    Label,Description,Side
2170    1,CH13_left,left
2171    2,CH13_right,right
2172    3,NBM_left_ant,left
2173    4,NBM_left_mid,left
2174    5,NBM_left_pos,left
2175    6,NBM_right_ant,right
2176    7,NBM_right_mid,right
2177    8,NBM_right_pos,right
2178
2179    Failure modes will include odd image orientation (in which case you might
2180    use the registration option).  A more nefarious issue can be a poor extraction
2181    of the cerebrum in the inferior frontal lobe.  These can be unpredictable
2182    but if one sees a bad extraction, please check the mask that is output by
2183    this function to see if it excludes non-cerebral tissue.
2184
2185    """
2186
2187    labels = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8]
2188    label_descriptions = ['background',
2189                          'CH13_left',
2190                          'CH13_right',
2191                          'NBM_left_ant',
2192                          'NBM_left_mid',
2193                          'NBM_left_pos',
2194                          'NBM_right_ant',
2195                          'NBM_right_mid',
2196                          'NBM_right_pos',
2197                          ]
2198
2199    t1use = ants.iMath( t1, "Normalize" )
2200    if registration:
2201        nbmtemplate = ants.image_read(get_data("nbm_template", target_extension=".nii.gz"))
2202        orireg = ants.registration( fixed = nbmtemplate,
2203            moving = t1use,
2204            type_of_transform="antsRegistrationSyNQuickRepro[a]", total_sigma=0.5,verbose=False )
2205        t1use = orireg['warpedmovout']
2206
2207    template = ants.image_read(get_data("CIT168_T1w_700um_pad_adni", target_extension=".nii.gz"))
2208    templateSmall = ants.resample_image( template, [2.0,2.0,2.0] )
2209    registrationsyn = ants.registration(
2210        fixed=templateSmall,
2211        moving=ants.iMath(t1use,"Normalize"),
2212        type_of_transform="antsRegistrationSyNQuickRepro[s]", total_sigma=0.5, verbose=False )
2213
2214    if verbose:
2215        print( registrationsyn['fwdtransforms'] )
2216
2217    image = ants.iMath( t1use, "TruncateIntensity", 0.0001, 0.999 ).iMath("Normalize")
2218    bfPriorL1 = ants.image_read(get_data("CIT168_basal_forebrain_adni_prob_1_left", target_extension=".nii.gz"))
2219    bfPriorR1 = ants.image_read(get_data("CIT168_basal_forebrain_adni_prob_1_right", target_extension=".nii.gz"))
2220    bfPriorL2 = ants.image_read(get_data("CIT168_basal_forebrain_adni_prob_2_left", target_extension=".nii.gz"))
2221    bfPriorR2 = ants.image_read(get_data("CIT168_basal_forebrain_adni_prob_2_right", target_extension=".nii.gz"))
2222
2223    patchSize = [ 64, 64, 32 ]
2224    priorL1tosub = ants.apply_transforms( image, bfPriorL1, registrationsyn['invtransforms'] ).smooth_image( 3 ).iMath("Normalize")
2225    priorR1tosub = ants.apply_transforms( image, bfPriorR1, registrationsyn['invtransforms'] ).smooth_image( 3 ).iMath("Normalize")
2226    priorL2tosub = ants.apply_transforms( image, bfPriorL2, registrationsyn['invtransforms'] ).smooth_image( 3 ).iMath("Normalize")
2227    priorR2tosub = ants.apply_transforms( image, bfPriorR2, registrationsyn['invtransforms'] ).smooth_image( 3 ).iMath("Normalize")
2228
2229    if binary_mask is None:
2230        masker = ants.threshold_image(image, np.quantile(image[image>1e-4], csfquantile ), 1e9 )
2231    else:
2232        masker = ants.apply_transforms( image, binary_mask,
2233            orireg['fwdtransforms'], interpolator='nearestNeighbor' )
2234
2235    ch13point = ants.get_center_of_mass( priorL1tosub + priorR1tosub )
2236
2237    nchanCH13 = 1
2238    nclasstosegCH13 = 3 # for ch13
2239    nchanNBM = 2
2240    nclasstosegNBM = 4 # for nbm
2241    actor = 'classification'
2242    nfilt = 32
2243    addoptsNBM = "nnUnetActivationStyle"
2244    unetCH13 = antspynet.create_unet_model_3d(
2245         [ None, None, None, nchanCH13 ],
2246         number_of_outputs = nclasstosegCH13, # number of landmarks must be known
2247         number_of_layers = 4, # should optimize this wrt criterion
2248         number_of_filters_at_base_layer = 32, # should optimize this wrt criterion
2249         convolution_kernel_size = 3, # maybe should optimize this wrt criterion
2250         deconvolution_kernel_size = 2,
2251         pool_size = 2,
2252         strides = 2,
2253         dropout_rate = 0,
2254         weight_decay = 0,
2255         mode = 'classification' )
2256    unetCH13.load_weights( ch13_weights )
2257
2258    physspace = special_crop( image, ch13point, patchSize)
2259    ch13array = physspace.numpy()
2260    newshape = list( ch13array.shape )
2261    newshape.insert(0,1)
2262    newshape.append(1)
2263    ch13pred = unetCH13.predict( tf.reshape( ch13array, newshape ) )
2264    probability_images = []
2265    for jj in range(3):
2266        temp = ants.from_numpy( ch13pred[0,:,:,:,jj] )
2267        probability_images.append( ants.copy_image_info( physspace, temp ) )
2268    bint = physspace * 0 + 1
2269    image_matrix = ants.image_list_to_matrix(probability_images[1:(len(probability_images))], bint )
2270    background_foreground_matrix = np.stack([ants.image_list_to_matrix([probability_images[0]], bint),
2271        np.expand_dims(np.sum(image_matrix, axis=0), axis=0)])
2272    foreground_matrix = np.argmax(background_foreground_matrix, axis=0)
2273    segmentation_matrix = (np.argmax(image_matrix, axis=0) + 1) * foreground_matrix
2274    segmentation_image = ants.matrix_to_images(np.expand_dims(segmentation_matrix, axis=0), bint)[0]
2275    relabeled_image = ants.image_clone(segmentation_image)
2276    ch13totalback = ants.resample_image_to_target(relabeled_image, image, interp_type='nearestNeighbor') * masker
2277    if registration:
2278        ch13totalback = ants.apply_transforms( t1, ch13totalback,
2279            orireg['invtransforms'][0], whichtoinvert=[True], interpolator='nearestNeighbor' )
2280
2281    if verbose:
2282        print("CH13 done")
2283
2284    maskind = 3
2285    nlayers =  4 # for unet
2286    unet1 = antspynet.create_unet_model_3d(
2287         [ None, None, None, 2 ],
2288          number_of_outputs = 1, # number of landmarks must be known
2289           number_of_layers = 4, # should optimize this wrt criterion
2290           number_of_filters_at_base_layer = 32, # should optimize this wrt criterion
2291           convolution_kernel_size = 3, # maybe should optimize this wrt criterion
2292           deconvolution_kernel_size = 2,
2293           pool_size = 2,
2294           strides = 2,
2295           dropout_rate = 0.0,
2296           weight_decay = 0,
2297           additional_options = "nnUnetActivationStyle",
2298           mode = "sigmoid" )
2299    maskinput = tf.keras.layers.Input( [ None, None,  None, 1 ] )
2300    posteriorMask1 = tf.keras.layers.multiply(
2301      [ unet1.outputs[0] , maskinput ], name='maskTimesPosteriors1'  )
2302    unet = tf.keras.models.Model( [ unet1.inputs[0], maskinput ], posteriorMask1 )
2303
2304    unet2 = antspynet.create_unet_model_3d(
2305         [ None, None, None, 2 ],
2306          number_of_outputs = nclasstosegNBM, # number of landmarks must be known
2307           number_of_layers = 4, # should optimize this wrt criterion
2308           number_of_filters_at_base_layer = 32, # should optimize this wrt criterion
2309           convolution_kernel_size = 3, # maybe should optimize this wrt criterion
2310           deconvolution_kernel_size = 2,
2311           pool_size = 2,
2312           strides = 2,
2313           dropout_rate = 0.0,
2314           weight_decay = 0,
2315           additional_options = "nnUnetActivationStyle",
2316           mode =  "classification" )
2317
2318    temp = tf.split( unet1.inputs[0], 2, axis=4 )
2319    temp[1] = unet.outputs[0]
2320    newmult = tf.concat( temp, axis=4 )
2321    unetonnet = unet2( newmult )
2322    unetNBM = tf.keras.models.Model(
2323        unet.inputs,
2324        [ unetonnet,  unet.outputs[0] ] )
2325    unetNBM.load_weights( nbm_weights )
2326
2327    # do each side separately
2328    bfseg = t1 * 0.0
2329    for nbmnum in [0,1]:
2330        if nbmnum == 0:
2331            nbmpoint = ants.get_center_of_mass( priorL2tosub )
2332            nbmprior = special_crop( priorL2tosub, nbmpoint, patchSize).numpy() # prior
2333            labels=[3,4,5]
2334        if nbmnum == 1:
2335            nbmpoint = ants.get_center_of_mass( priorR2tosub )
2336            nbmprior = special_crop( priorR2tosub, nbmpoint, patchSize).numpy() # prior
2337            labels=[6,7,8]
2338        physspaceNBM = special_crop( image, nbmpoint, patchSize) # image
2339        nbmmask = special_crop( masker, nbmpoint, patchSize).numpy() # mask
2340        tfarr1 = tf.stack( [physspaceNBM.numpy(),nbmprior], axis=3  )
2341        newshapeNBM = list( tfarr1.shape )
2342        newshapeNBM.insert(0,1)
2343        tfarr1 = tf.reshape(tfarr1, newshapeNBM )
2344        tfarr2 = tf.reshape( nbmmask, newshape )
2345        nbmpred = unetNBM.predict( ( tfarr1, tfarr2  ) )
2346        segpred = nbmpred[0]
2347        sigmoidpred = nbmpred[1]
2348        nbmpred1_image = ants.from_numpy( sigmoidpred[0,:,:,:,0] )
2349        nbmpred1_image = ants.copy_image_info( physspaceNBM, nbmpred1_image )
2350        bint = ants.threshold_image( nbmpred1_image, 0.5, 1.0 ).iMath("GetLargestComponent",1)
2351        probability_images = []
2352        for jj in range(3):
2353            temp = ants.from_numpy( segpred[0,:,:,:,jj+1] )
2354            probability_images.append( ants.copy_image_info( physspaceNBM, temp ) )
2355        image_matrix = ants.image_list_to_matrix(probability_images, bint)
2356        segmentation_matrix = (np.argmax(image_matrix, axis=0) + 1)
2357        segmentation_image = ants.matrix_to_images(np.expand_dims(segmentation_matrix, axis=0), bint)[0]
2358        relabeled_image = ants.image_clone(segmentation_image)
2359        for i in range(len(labels)):
2360            relabeled_image[segmentation_image==(i+1)] = labels[i]
2361        relabeled_image = ants.resample_image_to_target(relabeled_image, image, interp_type='nearestNeighbor')
2362        if registration:
2363            relabeled_image = ants.apply_transforms( t1, relabeled_image,
2364                    orireg['invtransforms'][0], whichtoinvert=[True],
2365                    interpolator='nearestNeighbor' )
2366        if verbose:
2367            print("NBM" + str( nbmnum ) )
2368        bfseg = bfseg + relabeled_image
2369    bfseg = ch13totalback + bfseg * ants.threshold_image( ch13totalback, 0, 0 )
2370    bfsegdesc = map_segmentation_to_dataframe( 'nbm3CH13', bfseg )
2371
2372    if registration:
2373        masker = ants.apply_transforms( t1, masker,
2374            orireg['invtransforms'][0], whichtoinvert=[True],
2375            interpolator='nearestNeighbor' )
2376
2377    return { 'segmentation':bfseg, 'description':bfsegdesc, 'mask': masker }

2383def deep_cit168( t1, binary_mask = None,
2384    syn_type='antsRegistrationSyNQuickRepro[s]',
2385    priors = None, verbose = False):
2386
2387    """
2388    CIT168 atlas segmentation with a parcellation unet.
2389
2390    Perform CIT168 segmentation in T1 images using Pauli atlas (CIT168) labels.
2391
2392    t1 : T1-weighted neuroimage antsImage - already brain extracted.  image should
2393    be normalized 0 to 1 and with a nicely uniform histogram (no major outliers).
2394    we do a little work internally to help this but no guarantees it will handle
2395    all possible confounding issues.
2396
2397    binary_mask : will restrict output to this mask
2398
2399    syn_type : the type of registration used for generating priors; usually
2400       either SyN or antsRegistrationSyNQuickRepro[s] for repeatable results
2401
2402    priors : the user can provide their own priors through this argument; for
2403       example, the user may run this function twice, with the output of the first
2404       giving input to the second run.
2405
2406    verbose: boolean
2407
2408    Failure modes will primarily occur around red nucleus and caudate nucleus.
2409    For the latter, one might consider masking by the ventricular CSF, in particular
2410    near the anterior and inferior portion of the caudate in subjects with
2411    large ventricles.  Low quality images with high atropy are also likely outside
2412    of the current range of the trained models. Iterating the model may help.
2413
2414    """
2415    def tfsubset( x, indices ):
2416        with tf.device('/CPU:0'):
2417            outlist = []
2418            for k in indices:
2419                outlist.append( x[:,:,:,int(k)] )
2420            return tf.stack( outlist, axis=3 )
2421
2422    def tfsubsetbatch( x, indices ):
2423        with tf.device('/CPU:0'):
2424            outlist2 = []
2425            for j in range( len( x ) ):
2426                outlist = []
2427                for k in indices:
2428                    if len( x[j].shape ) == 5:
2429                        outlist.append( x[j][k,:,:,:,:] )
2430                    if len( x[j].shape ) == 4:
2431                        outlist.append( x[j][k,:,:,:] )
2432                outlist2.append( tf.stack( outlist, axis=0 ) )
2433        return outlist2
2434
2435
2436    registration = True
2437    cit168seg = t1 * 0
2438    myprior = ants.image_read(get_data("det_atlas_25_pad_LR_adni", target_extension=".nii.gz"))
2439    nbmtemplate = ants.image_read( get_data( "CIT168_T1w_700um_pad_adni", target_extension=".nii.gz" ) )
2440    nbmtemplate = ants.resample_image( nbmtemplate, [0.5,0.5,0.5] )
2441    templateSmall = ants.resample_image( nbmtemplate, [2.0,2.0,2.0] )
2442    orireg = ants.registration(
2443                    fixed = templateSmall,
2444                    moving = ants.iMath( t1, "Normalize" ),
2445                    type_of_transform=syn_type, total_sigma=0.5, verbose=False )
2446    image = ants.apply_transforms( nbmtemplate, ants.iMath( t1, "Normalize" ),
2447        orireg['fwdtransforms'][1] )
2448    image = ants.iMath( image, "TruncateIntensity",0.001,0.999).iMath("Normalize")
2449    patchSize = [ 160,160,112 ]
2450    if priors is None:
2451        priortosub = ants.apply_transforms( image, myprior,
2452            orireg['invtransforms'][1], interpolator='nearestNeighbor' )
2453    else:
2454        if verbose:
2455            print("using priors")
2456        priortosub = ants.apply_transforms( image, priors,
2457            orireg['fwdtransforms'][1], interpolator='nearestNeighbor' )
2458    bmask = ants.threshold_image( priortosub, 1, 999 )
2459    # this identifies the cropping location - assumes a good registration
2460    pt = list( ants.get_center_of_mass( bmask ) )
2461    pt[1] = pt[1] + 10.0  # same as we did in training
2462
2463    physspaceCIT = special_crop( image, pt, patchSize) # image
2464
2465    if binary_mask is not None:
2466        binary_mask_use = ants.apply_transforms( nbmtemplate, binary_mask,
2467            orireg['fwdtransforms'][1] )
2468        binary_mask_use = special_crop( binary_mask_use, pt, patchSize)
2469
2470    for sn in [True,False]:
2471        if sn:
2472            group_labels = [0,7,8,9,23,24,25,33,34]
2473            newfn=get_data( "deepCIT168_sn", target_extension=".h5" )
2474        else:
2475            group_labels = [0,1,2,5,6,17,18,21,22]
2476            newfn=get_data( "deepCIT168", target_extension=".h5" )
2477
2478        number_of_outputs = len(group_labels)
2479        number_of_channels = len(group_labels)
2480
2481        unet0 = antspynet.create_unet_model_3d(
2482                 [ None, None, None, number_of_channels ],
2483                 number_of_outputs = 1, # number of landmarks must be known
2484                 number_of_layers = 4, # should optimize this wrt criterion
2485                 number_of_filters_at_base_layer = 32, # should optimize this wrt criterion
2486                 convolution_kernel_size = 3, # maybe should optimize this wrt criterion
2487                 deconvolution_kernel_size = 2,
2488                 pool_size = 2,
2489                 strides = 2,
2490                 dropout_rate = 0.0,
2491                 weight_decay = 0,
2492                 additional_options = "nnUnetActivationStyle",
2493                 mode =  "sigmoid" )
2494
2495        unet1 = antspynet.create_unet_model_3d(
2496            [None,None,None,2],
2497            number_of_outputs=number_of_outputs,
2498            mode="classification",
2499            number_of_filters=(32, 64, 96, 128, 256),
2500            convolution_kernel_size=(3, 3, 3),
2501            deconvolution_kernel_size=(2, 2, 2),
2502            dropout_rate=0.0,
2503            weight_decay=0,
2504            additional_options = "nnUnetActivationStyle")
2505
2506#        temp = tf.split( unet0.inputs[0], 9, axis=4 )
2507        import tensorflow as tf
2508        from tensorflow.keras.layers import Layer
2509        class mySplit(Layer):
2510            def call(self, x):
2511                return tf.split(x, 9, axis=4 )
2512        temp = mySplit()( unet0.inputs[0] )
2513
2514        temp[1] = unet0.outputs[0]
2515
2516        class myConcat(Layer):
2517            def call(self, x):
2518                return tf.concat(x, axis=4 )
2519#        newmult = tf.concat( temp[0:2], axis=4 )
2520        newmult = myConcat()( temp[0:2] )
2521        unetonnet = unet1( newmult )
2522        unet_model = tf.keras.models.Model(
2523                unet0.inputs,
2524                [ unetonnet,  unet0.outputs[0] ] )
2525        unet_model.load_weights( newfn )
2526        ###################
2527        nbmprior = special_crop( priortosub, pt, patchSize).numpy() # prior
2528        imgnp = tf.reshape( physspaceCIT.numpy(), [160, 160, 112,1])
2529        nbmprior = tf.one_hot( nbmprior, 35 )
2530        nbmprior = tfsubset( nbmprior, group_labels[1:len(group_labels)] )
2531        imgnp = tf.reshape( tf.concat( [imgnp,nbmprior], axis=3), [1,160, 160, 112,9])
2532
2533        nbmpred = unet_model.predict( imgnp )
2534        segpred = nbmpred[0]
2535        sigmoidpred = nbmpred[1]
2536
2537        def map_back_cit( relo, t1, orireg, interpolator='linear' ):
2538            relo = ants.apply_transforms( t1, relo,
2539                    orireg['invtransforms'][0], whichtoinvert=[True],
2540                    interpolator=interpolator )
2541            return relo
2542
2543        nbmpred1_image = ants.from_numpy( sigmoidpred[0,:,:,:,0] )
2544        nbmpred1_image = ants.copy_image_info( physspaceCIT, nbmpred1_image )
2545        nbmpred1_image = map_back_cit( nbmpred1_image, t1, orireg, 'linear'  )
2546        if binary_mask is not None:
2547            nbmpred1_image = nbmpred1_image * binary_mask
2548        bint = ants.threshold_image( nbmpred1_image, 0.5, 1.0 )
2549
2550        probability_images = []
2551        for jj in range(1,len(group_labels)):
2552            temp = ants.from_numpy( segpred[0,:,:,:,jj] )
2553            temp = ants.copy_image_info( physspaceCIT, temp )
2554            temp = map_back_cit( temp, t1, orireg, 'linear'  )
2555            probability_images.append( temp )
2556
2557        image_matrix = ants.image_list_to_matrix(probability_images, bint)
2558        segmentation_matrix = (np.argmax(image_matrix, axis=0) + 1)
2559        segmentation_image = ants.matrix_to_images(np.expand_dims(segmentation_matrix, axis=0), bint)[0]
2560        relabeled_image = ants.image_clone(segmentation_image*0.)
2561        for i in np.unique(segmentation_image.numpy()):
2562            if i > 0 :
2563                temp = ants.threshold_image(segmentation_image,i,i)
2564                if group_labels[int(i)] < 33:
2565                    temp = ants.iMath( temp, "GetLargestComponent",1)
2566                relabeled_image = relabeled_image + temp*group_labels[int(i)]
2567        cit168seg = cit168seg + relabeled_image
2568
2569    cit168segdesc = map_segmentation_to_dataframe( 'CIT168_Reinf_Learn_v1_label_descriptions_pad', cit168seg ).dropna(axis=0)
2570
2571    return { 'segmentation':cit168seg, 'description':cit168segdesc }

2574def preprocess_intensity( x, brain_extraction,
2575    intensity_truncation_quantiles=[1e-4, 0.999],
2576    rescale_intensities=True  ):
2577    """
2578    Default intensity processing for a brain-extracted T1-weighted image.
2579
2580    Arguments
2581    ---------
2582
2583    x : T1-weighted neuroimage antsImage after brain extraction applied
2584
2585    brain_extraction : T1-weighted neuroimage brain extraction / segmentation
2586
2587    intensity_truncation_quantiles: parameters passed to TruncateIntensity; the
2588    first value truncates values below this quantile; the second truncates
2589    values above this quantile.
2590
2591    rescale_intensities: boolean passed to n4
2592
2593    Returns
2594    -------
2595    processed image
2596    """
2597    brain_extraction = ants.resample_image_to_target( brain_extraction, x, interp_type='nearestNeighbor' )
2598    img = x * brain_extraction
2599    # print( "PP input : " + str( img.mean() ) )
2600    img = ants.iMath( img, "TruncateIntensity", intensity_truncation_quantiles[0], intensity_truncation_quantiles[1] ).iMath( "Normalize" )
2601    # print( "PP Trunc : " + str( img.mean() ) )
2602    # img = ants.denoise_image( img, brain_extraction, noise_model='Gaussian')
2603    # print( "PP DNZ : " + str( img.mean() ) )
2604    img = ants.n4_bias_field_correction( img, mask=brain_extraction, rescale_intensities=rescale_intensities, ).iMath("Normalize")
2605    # print( "PP N4 : " + str( img.mean() ) )
2606    return img
2607
2608
2609def hierarchical( x, output_prefix, labels_to_register=[2,3,4,5],
2610    imgbxt=None, img6seg=None, cit168 = False, is_test=False,
2611    atropos_prior=None,
2612    sr_model = None,
2613    verbose=True ):
2614    """
2615    Default processing for a T1-weighted image.  See README.
2616
2617    Arguments
2618    ---------
2619    x : T1-weighted neuroimage antsImage
2620
2621    output_prefix: string directory and prefix
2622
2623    labels_to_register: list of integer segmentation labels (of 1 to 6 as defined
2624    by atropos: csf, gm, wm, dgm, brainstem, cerebellum) to define
2625    the tissue types / regions of the brain to register.  set to None to
2626    skip registration which will be faster but omit some results.
2627
2628    imgbxt : pre-existing brain extraction - a binary image - will disable some processing
2629
2630    img6seg: pre-existing brain segmentation - a 6-class image ( ANTs standard )
2631
2632    cit168 : boolean returns labels from CIT168 atlas with high-resolution registration
2633        otherwise, low-resolution regitration is used.
2634
2635    is_test: boolean ( parameters to run more quickly but with low quality )
2636
2637    atropos_prior: prior weight for atropos post-processing; set to None if you
2638        do not want to use this.  will modify the CSF, GM and WM segmentation to
2639        better fit the image intensity at the resolution of the input image.
2640
2641    sr_model: optional will trigger sr-based upsampling in some functions.
2642
2643    verbose: boolean
2644
2645    Returns
2646    -------
2647    dataframes and associated derived data
2648
2649        - brain_n4_dnz : extracted brain denoised and bias corrected
2650        - brain_extraction : brain mask
2651        - rbp:  random basis projection results
2652        - left_right : left righ hemisphere segmentation
2653        - dkt_parc : dictionary object containing segmentation labels
2654        - registration : dictionary object containing registration results
2655        - hippLR : dictionary object containing hippocampus results
2656        - medial_temporal_lobe : dictionary object containing deep_flash (medial temporal lobe parcellation) results
2657        - white_matter_hypointensity : dictionary object containing WMH results
2658        - wm_tractsL  : white matter tracts, left
2659        - wm_tractsR  : white matter tracts, right
2660        - dataframes : summary data frames
2661
2662    """
2663    if x.dimension != 3:
2664        raise ValueError('hierarchical: input image should be 3-dimensional')
2665
2666    if verbose:
2667        print("Read")
2668    tfn = get_data('T_template0', target_extension='.nii.gz' )
2669    tfnw = get_data('T_template0_WMP', target_extension='.nii.gz' )
2670    tlrfn = get_data('T_template0_LR', target_extension='.nii.gz' )
2671    bfn = antspynet.get_antsxnet_data( "croppedMni152" )
2672
2673    ##### read images and do simple bxt ops

2959def trim_segmentation_by_distance( segmentation, which_label, distance ):
2960    """
2961    trim a segmentation by the distance provided by the user. computes a distance
2962    transform from the segmentation - treated as binary - and trims the target
2963    label by that distance.
2964
2965    Arguments
2966    ---------
2967    segmentation : ants image segmentation
2968
2969    which_label : the label to trim
2970
2971    distance : float distance value
2972
2973    Returns
2974    -------
2975    trimmed_segmentation
2976
2977    Example
2978    -------
2979    >>> import ants
2980    >>> img = ants.image_read( ants.get_data( 'r16' ) )
2981    >>> seg = ants.threshold_image( img, "Otsu", 3 )
2982    >>> tseg = antspyt1w.trim_segmentation_by_distance( seg, 1, 10 )
2983    """
2984    bseg = ants.threshold_image( segmentation, 1, segmentation.max() )
2985    dist = ants.iMath( bseg, "MaurerDistance" ) * (-1.0)
2986    disttrim = ants.threshold_image( dist, distance, dist.max() )
2987    tarseg = ants.threshold_image( segmentation, which_label, which_label ) * disttrim
2988    segmentationtrim = segmentation.clone()
2989    segmentationtrim[ segmentation == which_label ] = 0
2990    return segmentationtrim + tarseg * which_label

2994def zoom_syn( target_image, template, template_segmentations,
2995    initial_registration,
2996    dilation = 4,
2997    regIterations = [25] ):
2998    """
2999    zoomed in syn - a hierarchical registration applied to a hierarchical segmentation
3000
3001    Initial registration is followed up by a refined and focused high-resolution registration.
3002    This is performed on the cropped image where the cropping region is determined
3003    by the first segmentation in the template_segmentations list.  Segmentations
3004    after the first one are assumed to exist as sub-regions of the first.  All
3005    segmentations are assumed to be binary.
3006
3007    Arguments
3008    ---------
3009    target_image : ants image at original resolution
3010
3011    template : ants image template to be mapped to the target image
3012
3013    template_segmentations : list of binary segmentation images
3014
3015    dilation : morphological dilation amount applied to the first segmentation and used for cropping
3016
3017    regIterations : parameter passed to ants.registration
3018
3019    Returns
3020    -------
3021    dictionary
3022        containing segmentation and registration results in addition to cropping results
3023
3024    Example
3025    -------
3026    >>> import ants
3027    >>> ireg = ants.registration( target_image, template, "antsRegistrationSyNQuickRepro[s]" )
3028    >>> xxx = antspyt1w.zoom_syn(  orb,  template, level2segs, ireg )
3029    """
3030    croppertem = ants.iMath( template_segmentations[0], "MD", dilation )
3031    templatecrop = ants.crop_image( template, croppertem )
3032    cropper = ants.apply_transforms( target_image,
3033        croppertem, initial_registration['fwdtransforms'],
3034        interpolator='linear' ).threshold_image(0.5,1.e9)
3035    croplow = ants.crop_image( target_image,  cropper )
3036    synnerlow = ants.registration( croplow, templatecrop,
3037        'SyNOnly', gradStep = 0.20, regIterations = regIterations, randomSeed=1,
3038        syn_metric='cc', syn_sampling=2, total_sigma=0.5,
3039        initialTransform = initial_registration['fwdtransforms'] )
3040    orlist = []
3041    for jj in range(len(template_segmentations)):
3042      target_imageg = ants.apply_transforms( target_image, template_segmentations[jj],
3043        synnerlow['fwdtransforms'],
3044        interpolator='linear' ).threshold_image(0.5,1e9)
3045      orlist.append( target_imageg )
3046    return{
3047          'segmentations': orlist,
3048          'registration': synnerlow,
3049          'croppedimage': croplow,
3050          'croppingmask': cropper
3051          }

3101

3103            "brain_n4_dnz": None,
3104            "brain_n4_dnz_png": None,
3105            "brain_extraction": None,
3106            "tissue_seg_png": None,

3151def write_hierarchical( hierarchical_object, output_prefix, verbose=False ):
3152    """
3153    standardized writing of output for hierarchical function
3154
3155    Arguments
3156    ---------
3157    hierarchical_object : output of antspyt1w.hierarchical
3158
3159    output_prefix : string path including directory and file prefix that will
3160        be applied to all output, both csv and images.
3161
3162    verbose: boolean
3163
3164    Returns
3165    -------
3166    None
3167
3168    """
3169
3170    # write extant dataframes
3171    for myvar in hierarchical_object['dataframes'].keys():
3172        if hierarchical_object['dataframes'][myvar] is not None:
3173            if verbose:
3174                print( myvar )
3175            hierarchical_object['dataframes'][myvar].dropna(axis=0).to_csv(output_prefix + myvar + ".csv")
3176
3177    myvarlist = hierarchical_object.keys()
3178    r16img = ants.image_read( ants.get_data( "r16" ))
3179    for myvar in myvarlist:
3180        if hierarchical_object[myvar] is not None and type(hierarchical_object[myvar]) == type( r16img ):
3181            if verbose:
3182                print( output_prefix + myvar )
3183            ants.image_write( hierarchical_object[myvar], output_prefix + myvar + '.nii.gz' )
3184
3185    myvarlist = [
3186        'tissue_segmentation',
3187        'dkt_parcellation',
3188        'dkt_lobes',
3189        'dkt_cortex',
3190        'hemisphere_labels' ]
3191    for myvar in myvarlist:
3192        if hierarchical_object['dkt_parc'][myvar] is not None:
3193            if verbose:
3194                print( output_prefix + myvar )
3195            ants.image_write( hierarchical_object['dkt_parc'][myvar], output_prefix + myvar + '.nii.gz' )
3196
3197    return

3202def merge_hierarchical_csvs_to_wide_format( hierarchical_dataframes, col_names = None , identifier=None, identifier_name='u_hier_id', verbose=False ):
3203    """
3204    standardized merging of output for dataframes produced by hierarchical function.
3205
3206    Arguments
3207    ---------
3208    hierarchical_dataframes : output of antspyt1w.hierarchical
3209
3210    identifier : unique subject identifier e.g. subject_001
3211
3212    identifier_name : string name for the unique identifer column e.g. subject_id
3213
3214    Returns
3215    -------
3216    data frame in wide format
3217
3218    """
3219    if identifier is None:
3220        identifier='A'
3221    wide_df = pd.DataFrame( )
3222    icvkey='icv'
3223    if icvkey in hierarchical_dataframes.keys():
3224        temp = hierarchical_dataframes[icvkey].copy()
3225        temp = temp.loc[:, ~temp.columns.str.contains('^Unnamed')]
3226        temp.insert(loc=0, column=identifier_name, value=identifier)
3227        temp = temp.set_index(identifier_name)
3228        wide_df = wide_df.join(temp,how='outer')
3229    for myvar in hierarchical_dataframes.keys():
3230        if verbose:
3231            print( myvar )
3232        if hierarchical_dataframes[myvar] is not None:
3233            jdf = hierarchical_dataframes[myvar].dropna(axis=0)
3234            jdf = jdf.loc[:, ~jdf.columns.str.contains('^Unnamed')]
3235            if col_names is not None :
3236                for col_name in col_names :
3237                    if jdf.shape[0] > 1 and any( jdf.columns.str.contains(col_name)):
3238                        varsofinterest = ["Description", col_name]
3239                        jdfsub = jdf[varsofinterest]
3240                        jdfsub.insert(loc=0, column=identifier_name, value=identifier)
3241                        jdfsub = jdfsub.set_index([identifier_name, 'Description'])[col_name].unstack().add_prefix(col_name + '_')
3242                        jdfsub.columns=jdfsub.columns
3243                        jdfsub = jdfsub.rename(mapper=lambda x: x.strip().replace(' ', '_').lower(), axis=1)
3244                        wide_df = wide_df.join(jdfsub,how='outer')
3245            if jdf.shape[0] > 1 and any( jdf.columns.str.contains('VolumeInMillimeters')):
3246                varsofinterest = ["Description", "VolumeInMillimeters"]
3247                jdfsub = jdf[varsofinterest]
3248                jdfsub.insert(loc=0, column=identifier_name, value=identifier)
3249                jdfsub=jdfsub.set_index([identifier_name, 'Description']).VolumeInMillimeters.unstack().add_prefix('Vol_')
3250                jdfsub.columns=jdfsub.columns+myvar
3251                jdfsub = jdfsub.rename(mapper=lambda x: x.strip().replace(' ', '_').lower(), axis=1)
3252                wide_df = wide_df.join(jdfsub,how='outer')
3253            if jdf.shape[0] > 1 and any( jdf.columns.str.contains('SurfaceAreaInMillimetersSquared')):
3254                varsofinterest = ["Description", "SurfaceAreaInMillimetersSquared"]
3255                jdfsub = jdf[varsofinterest]
3256                jdfsub.insert(loc=0, column=identifier_name, value=identifier)
3257                jdfsub=jdfsub.set_index([identifier_name, 'Description']).SurfaceAreaInMillimetersSquared.unstack().add_prefix('Area_')
3258                jdfsub.columns=jdfsub.columns+myvar
3259                jdfsub = jdfsub.rename(mapper=lambda x: x.strip().replace(' ', '_').lower(), axis=1)
3260                wide_df = wide_df.join(jdfsub,how='outer')
3261            if jdf.shape[0] > 1 and any( jdf.columns.str.contains('SurfaceAreaInMillimetersSquared')) and any( jdf.columns.str.contains('VolumeInMillimeters')):
3262                varsofinterest = ["Description", "VolumeInMillimeters", "SurfaceAreaInMillimetersSquared"]
3263                jdfsub = jdf[varsofinterest]
3264                jdfsub.insert(loc=0, column=identifier_name, value=identifier)
3265                jdfsub.insert(loc=1, column='thickness',value=jdfsub['VolumeInMillimeters']/jdfsub['SurfaceAreaInMillimetersSquared'])
3266                jdfsub=jdfsub.set_index([identifier_name, 'Description']).thickness.unstack().add_prefix('Thk_')
3267                jdfsub.columns=jdfsub.columns+myvar
3268                jdfsub = jdfsub.rename(mapper=lambda x: x.strip().replace(' ', '_').lower(), axis=1)
3269                wide_df = wide_df.join(jdfsub,how='outer')
3270    rbpkey='rbp'
3271    if rbpkey in hierarchical_dataframes.keys():
3272        temp = hierarchical_dataframes[rbpkey].copy()
3273        temp = temp.loc[:, ~temp.columns.str.contains('^Unnamed')]
3274        temp.insert(loc=0, column=identifier_name, value=identifier)
3275        temp = temp.set_index(identifier_name)
3276        wide_df = wide_df.join(temp,how='outer')
3277    # handle wmh
3278    wmhkey='wmh'
3279    if wmhkey in hierarchical_dataframes.keys():
3280        df=hierarchical_dataframes[wmhkey].copy()
3281        df.insert(loc=0, column=identifier_name, value=identifier)
3282        df = df.set_index(identifier_name)
3283        wmhval = df.loc[ df.Description == 'Volume_of_WMH','Value']
3284        wide_df.insert(loc = 0, column = 'wmh_vol', value =wmhval )
3285        wmhval = df.loc[ df.Description == 'Integral_WMH_probability','Value']
3286        wide_df.insert(loc = 0, column = 'wmh_integral_prob', value =wmhval )
3287        wmhval = df.loc[ df.Description == 'Log_Evidence','Value']
3288        wide_df.insert(loc = 0, column = 'wmh_log_evidence', value =wmhval )
3289        wide_df['wmh_log_evidence']=wmhval
3290    wide_df.insert(loc = 0, column = identifier_name, value = identifier)
3291    return wide_df

3296def super_resolution_segmentation_per_label(
3297    imgIn,
3298    segmentation, # segmentation label image
3299    upFactor,
3300    sr_model,
3301    segmentation_numbers,
3302    dilation_amount = 0,
3303    probability_images=None, # probability list
3304    probability_labels=None, # the segmentation ids for the probability image,
3305    max_lab_plus_one=True,
3306    target_range=[1,0],
3307    poly_order = 'hist',
3308    verbose = False,
3309):
3310    """
3311    Apply a two-channel super resolution model to an image and probability pair.
3312
3313    Arguments
3314    ---------
3315    imgIn : ANTsImage
3316        image to be upsampled
3317
3318    segmentation : ANTsImage
3319        segmentation probability, n-ary or binary image
3320
3321    upFactor : list
3322        the upsampling factors associated with the super-resolution model
3323
3324    sr_model : tensorflow model or String
3325        for computing super-resolution; String denotes an interpolation type
3326
3327    segmentation_numbers : list of target segmentation labels
3328        list containing integer segmentation labels
3329
3330    dilation_amount : integer
3331        amount to pad around each segmentation defining region over which to
3332        computer the super-resolution in each label
3333
3334    probability_images : list of ANTsImages
3335        list of probability images
3336
3337    probability_labels : integer list
3338        providing the integer values associated with each probability image
3339
3340    max_lab_plus_one : boolean
3341        add background label
3342
3343    target_range : lower and upper limit of intensity expected by network [1,0] if trained by siq
3344
3345    poly_order : integer or 'hist' or None
3346
3347    verbose : boolean
3348        whether to show status updates
3349
3350    Returns
3351    -------
3352
3353    dictionary w/ following key/value pairs:
3354        `super_resolution` : ANTsImage
3355            super_resolution image
3356
3357        `super_resolution_segmentation` : ANTsImage
3358            super_resolution_segmentation image
3359
3360        `segmentation_geometry` : list of data frame types
3361            segmentation geometry for each label
3362
3363        `probability_images` : list of ANTsImage
3364            segmentation probability maps
3365
3366
3367    Example
3368    -------
3369    >>> import ants
3370    >>> ref = ants.image_read( ants.get_ants_data('r16'))
3371    """
3372    import re
3373    if type( sr_model ) == type(""):
3374        if re.search( 'h5', sr_model ) is not None:
3375            if verbose:
3376                print("load model")
3377            sr_model=tf.keras.models.load_model( sr_model, compile=False )
3378    newspc = ( np.asarray( ants.get_spacing( imgIn ) ) ).tolist()
3379    for k in range(len(newspc)):
3380        newspc[k] = newspc[k]/upFactor[k]
3381    imgup = ants.resample_image( imgIn, newspc, use_voxels=False, interp_type=0 )
3382    imgsrfull = imgup * 0.0
3383    weightedavg = imgup * 0.0
3384    problist = []
3385    bkgdilate = 2
3386    segmentationUse = ants.image_clone( segmentation )
3387    segmentationUse = ants.mask_image( segmentationUse, segmentationUse, segmentation_numbers )
3388    segmentation_numbers_use = segmentation_numbers.copy()
3389    if max_lab_plus_one:
3390        background = ants.mask_image( segmentationUse, segmentationUse, segmentation_numbers, binarize=True )
3391        background = ants.iMath(background,"MD",bkgdilate) - background
3392        backgroundup = ants.resample_image_to_target( background, imgup, interp_type='linear' )
3393        segmentation_numbers_use.append( max(segmentation_numbers) + 1 )
3394        segmentationUse = segmentationUse + background * max(segmentation_numbers_use)
3395
3396    for locallab in segmentation_numbers:
3397        if verbose:
3398            print( "SR-per-label:" + str( locallab ) )
3399        binseg = ants.threshold_image( segmentationUse, locallab, locallab )
3400        sizethresh = 2
3401        if ( binseg == 1 ).sum() < sizethresh :
3402            warnings.warn( "SR-per-label:" + str( locallab ) + ' is small' )
3403        if ( binseg == 1 ).sum() >= sizethresh :
3404            minprob="NA"
3405            maxprob="NA"
3406            if probability_images is not None:
3407                whichprob = probability_labels.index(locallab)
3408                probimg = probability_images[whichprob].resample_image_to_target( binseg )
3409                minprob = min( probimg[ binseg >= 0.5 ] )
3410                maxprob = max( probimg[ binseg >= 0.5 ] )
3411            if verbose:
3412                print( "SR-per-label:" + str( locallab ) + " min/max-prob: " + str(minprob)+ " / " + str(maxprob)  )
3413            binsegdil = ants.iMath( ants.threshold_image( segmentationUse, locallab, locallab ), "MD", dilation_amount )
3414            binsegdil2input = ants.resample_image_to_target( binsegdil, imgIn, interp_type='nearestNeighbor'  )
3415            imgc = ants.crop_image( ants.iMath(imgIn,"Normalize"), binsegdil2input )
3416            imgc = imgc * target_range[0] - target_range[1] # for SR
3417            imgchCore = ants.crop_image( binseg, binsegdil )
3418            if probability_images is not None:
3419                imgchCore = ants.crop_image( probimg, binsegdil )
3420#            imgch = ants.iMath( imgchCore, "Normalize" ) * target_range[0] - target_range[1] # for SR
3421            imgch = imgchCore * target_range[0] - target_range[1] # for SR
3422            if type( sr_model ) == type(""): # this is just for testing
3423                binsegup = ants.resample_image_to_target( binseg, imgup, interp_type='linear' )
3424                problist.append( binsegup )
3425            else:
3426                if verbose:
3427                    print(imgc)
3428                    print(imgch)
3429                myarr = np.stack( [imgc.numpy(),imgch.numpy()],axis=3 )
3430                newshape = np.concatenate( [ [1],np.asarray( myarr.shape )] )
3431                myarr = myarr.reshape( newshape )
3432                if verbose:
3433                    print("calling prediction function")
3434                    print("arr range " + str(myarr.max() ) + " " + str(myarr.min() ) )
3435                    print( myarr.shape )
3436                pred = sr_model.predict( myarr )
3437                predshape = np.asarray(pred).shape
3438                predshapelen = len( predshape )
3439                if predshape[ predshapelen - 1] == 2:
3440                    pred = tf.split( pred, 2, axis=4 )
3441                if verbose:
3442                    print("predict done")
3443                imgsr = ants.from_numpy( tf.squeeze( pred[0] ).numpy())
3444                if verbose:
3445                    print( imgc )
3446                    print( imgsr )
3447                imgsr = ants.copy_image_info( imgc, imgsr )
3448                ants.set_spacing( imgsr,  newspc )
3449                imgsrh = ants.from_numpy( tf.squeeze( pred[1] ).numpy())
3450                imgsrh = ants.copy_image_info( imgc, imgsrh )
3451                ants.set_spacing( imgsrh,  newspc )
3452                if poly_order is not None:
3453                    if poly_order == 'hist':
3454                        if verbose:
3455                            print("hist match intensity")
3456                        imgsrh = ants.histogram_match_image( imgsrh, imgchCore )
3457                        imgsr = ants.histogram_match_image( imgsr, imgc )
3458                    else:
3459                        if verbose:
3460                            print("poly match intensity")
3461                        imgsr = ants.regression_match_image( imgsr, ants.resample_image_to_target(imgup,imgsr), poly_order=poly_order )
3462                        imgsrh = ants.regression_match_image( imgsrh, ants.resample_image_to_target(imgchCore,imgsr), poly_order=poly_order )
3463                problist.append( imgsrh )
3464                contribtoavg = ants.resample_image_to_target( imgsr*0+1, imgup, interp_type='nearestNeighbor' )
3465                weightedavg = weightedavg + contribtoavg
3466                imgsrfull = imgsrfull + ants.resample_image_to_target( imgsr, imgup, interp_type='nearestNeighbor' )
3467
3468    if max_lab_plus_one:
3469        problist.append( backgroundup )
3470
3471    imgsrfull2 = imgsrfull
3472    selector = imgsrfull == 0
3473    imgsrfull2[ selector  ] = imgup[ selector ]
3474    weightedavg[ weightedavg == 0.0 ] = 1.0
3475    imgsrfull2=imgsrfull2/weightedavg
3476    imgsrfull2[ imgup == 0 ] = 0
3477
3478    for k in range(len(problist)):
3479        problist[k] = ants.resample_image_to_target(problist[k],imgsrfull2,interp_type='linear')
3480
3481    if max_lab_plus_one:
3482        tarmask = ants.threshold_image( segmentationUse, 1, segmentationUse.max() )
3483    else:
3484        tarmask = ants.threshold_image( segmentationUse, 1, segmentationUse.max() ).iMath("MD",1)
3485    tarmask = ants.resample_image_to_target( tarmask, imgsrfull2, interp_type='nearestNeighbor' )
3486
3487
3488    if True: # we dont generally know which of these is background/foreground so .....
3489        segmat = ants.images_to_matrix(problist, tarmask)
3490        finalsegvec = segmat.argmax(axis=0)
3491        finalsegvec2 = finalsegvec.copy()
3492        for i in range(len(problist)):
3493            segnum = segmentation_numbers_use[i]
3494            finalsegvec2[finalsegvec == i] = segnum
3495        outimg = ants.make_image(tarmask, finalsegvec2)
3496        outimg = ants.mask_image( outimg, outimg, segmentation_numbers )
3497        seggeom = ants.label_geometry_measures( outimg )
3498    else:
3499        image_matrix = ants.image_list_to_matrix(problist[0:(len(problist)-1)], tarmask )
3500        background_foreground_matrix = np.stack([ants.image_list_to_matrix([problist[len(problist)-1]], tarmask),
3501                                            np.expand_dims(np.sum(image_matrix, axis=0), axis=0)])
3502        foreground_matrix = np.argmax(background_foreground_matrix, axis=0)
3503        segmentation_matrix = (np.argmax(image_matrix, axis=0) + 1) * foreground_matrix
3504        segmentation_image = ants.matrix_to_images(np.expand_dims(segmentation_matrix, axis=0), tarmask)[0]
3505        outimg = ants.image_clone(segmentation_image)
3506        for i in range(len(problist)):
3507            outimg[segmentation_image==i] = segmentation_numbers_use[i]
3508        outimg = ants.mask_image( outimg, outimg, segmentation_numbers )
3509        seggeom = ants.label_geometry_measures( outimg )
3510
3511    return {
3512        "super_resolution": imgsrfull2,
3513        "super_resolution_segmentation": outimg,
3514        "segmentation_geometry": seggeom,
3515        "probability_images": problist
3516        }
3517

3521def super_resolution_segmentation_with_probabilities(
3522    img,
3523    initial_probabilities,
3524    sr_model,
3525    target_range=[1,0],
3526    verbose = False
3527):
3528    """
3529    Simultaneous super-resolution and probabilistic segmentation.
3530
3531    this function will perform localized super-resolution analysis on the
3532    underlying image content to produce a SR version of both the local region
3533    intentsity and segmentation probability.  the number of probability images
3534    determines the number of outputs for the intensity and probabilitiy list
3535    that are returned.  NOTE: should consider inverse logit transform option.
3536
3537    Arguments
3538    ---------
3539    img : input intensity image
3540
3541    initial_probabilities: original resolution probability images
3542
3543    sr_model : the super resolution model - should have 2 channel input
3544
3545    target_range : lower and upper limit of intensity expected by network [1,0] if trained by siq
3546
3547    verbose : boolean
3548
3549    Returns
3550    -------
3551    list of ANTsImages
3552
3553    """
3554
3555    # SR Part
3556    srimglist = []
3557    srproblist = []
3558    mypt = 1.0 / len(initial_probabilities)
3559
3560    for k in range(len(initial_probabilities)):
3561        if k == 0:
3562            srimglist.append( img )
3563            srproblist.append( initial_probabilities[k] )
3564        else:
3565            tempm = ants.threshold_image( initial_probabilities[k], mypt, 2 ).iMath("MD",1)
3566            imgc = ants.crop_image(img,tempm)
3567            imgch = ants.crop_image(initial_probabilities[k],tempm)
3568            if verbose:
3569                print(k)
3570                print(imgc)
3571            imgcrescale = ants.iMath( imgc, "Normalize" ) * target_range[0] - target_range[1] # for SR
3572            imgchrescale = imgch * target_range[0] - target_range[1]
3573            myarr = np.stack( [ imgcrescale.numpy(), imgchrescale.numpy() ],axis=3 )
3574            newshape = np.concatenate( [ [1],np.asarray( myarr.shape )] )
3575            myarr = myarr.reshape( newshape )
3576            pred = sr_model.predict( myarr )
3577            imgsr = ants.from_numpy( tf.squeeze( pred[0] ).numpy())
3578            imgsr = ants.copy_image_info( imgc, imgsr )
3579            newspc = ( np.asarray( ants.get_spacing( imgsr ) ) * 0.5 ).tolist()
3580            ants.set_spacing( imgsr,  newspc )
3581            if verbose:
3582                print(imgsr)
3583            imgsr = ants.regression_match_image( imgsr, ants.resample_image_to_target(imgc,imgsr) )
3584            imgsrh = ants.from_numpy( tf.squeeze( pred[1] ).numpy())
3585            imgsrh = ants.copy_image_info( imgsr, imgsrh )
3586            tempup = ants.resample_image_to_target( tempm, imgsr )
3587            srimglist.append( imgsr )
3588            # NOTE: get rid of pixellated junk/artifacts - acts like a prior
3589            srproblist.append( imgsrh * tempup )
3590
3591    if verbose:
3592        print("done srwithprob")
3593
3594    labels = {
3595        'sr_intensities':srimglist,
3596        'sr_probabilities':srproblist,
3597    }
3598    return labels

3600def kelly_kapowski_thickness( x, labels,
3601    label_description='dkt', iterations=45, max_thickness=6.0, mydap=None, verbose=False ):
3602    """
3603    Apply a two-channel super resolution model to an image and probability pair.
3604
3605    Arguments
3606    ---------
3607    x : ANTsImage
3608        raw t1 image
3609
3610    labels : ANTsImage
3611        cortical parcellation
3612
3613    label_description : pandas data frame
3614
3615    iterations : integer
3616        number of iterations ( probably not to be changed except for testing )
3617
3618    max_thickness : in mm to consider default is 6.0
3619
3620    verbose : boolean
3621
3622    Returns
3623    -------
3624
3625    dictionary w/ following key/value pairs:
3626        `thickness_image` : ANTsImage
3627
3628        `thickness_dataframe` : dataframe with mean thickness values
3629
3630    Example
3631    -------
3632    >>> import ants
3633    >>> thk = antspyt1w.kelly_kapowski_thickness( x )
3634    """
3635    if verbose:
3636        myverb=1
3637    else:
3638        myverb=0
3639    seg = deep_tissue_segmentation( x )
3640    kkthk = ants.kelly_kapowski( s=seg['segmentation_image'],
3641            g=seg['probability_images'][2], w=seg['probability_images'][3],
3642            its=iterations, r=0.025, m=1.5, verbose=myverb )
3643    kkthkmask = ants.threshold_image( kkthk, 0.25, max_thickness )
3644    kkdf = map_intensity_to_dataframe(
3645                  label_description,
3646                  kkthk,
3647                  labels * kkthkmask )
3648    kkdf_wide = merge_hierarchical_csvs_to_wide_format( {'KK' : kkdf}, col_names = ['Mean'] )
3649    return {
3650        'thickness_image' : kkthk,
3651        'thickness_dataframe' : kkdf_wide
3652    }

3655def minimal_sr_preprocessing( x, imgbxt=None ):
3656    """
3657    x : input t1 image (raw)
3658
3659    imgbxt : optional existing brain extraction
3660
3661    outputs: preprocessedT1, hemisphereLabels
3662    """
3663    if x.dimension != 3:
3664        raise ValueError('hierarchical: input image should be 3-dimensional')
3665
3666    tfn = get_data('T_template0', target_extension='.nii.gz' )
3667    tlrfn = get_data('T_template0_LR', target_extension='.nii.gz' )
3668
3669    ##### read images and do simple bxt ops
3670    templatea = ants.image_read( tfn )
3671    templatea = ( templatea * antspynet.brain_extraction( templatea, 't1' ) ).iMath( "Normalize" )
3672    templatealr = ants.image_read( tlrfn )
3673    if imgbxt is None:
3674        imgbxt = brain_extraction( ants.iMath( x, "Normalize" ) )
3675    img = preprocess_intensity( ants.iMath( x, "Normalize" ), imgbxt )
3676    img = ants.iMath( img, "Normalize" )
3677    mylr = label_hemispheres( img, templatea, templatealr )
3678    return img, mylr * imgbxt
def get_data(name=None, force_download=False, version=46, target_extension='.csv'): 
112def get_data(name=None, force_download=False, version=46, target_extension='.csv'):
113    """
114    Get ANTsPyT1w data filename
115
116    The first time this is called, it will download data to ~/.antspyt1w.
117    After, it will just read data from disk.  The ~/.antspyt1w may need to
118    be periodically deleted in order to ensure data is current.
119
120    Arguments
121    ---------
122    name : string
123        name of data tag to retrieve
124        Options:
125            - 'all'
126            - 'dkt'
127            - 'hemisphere'
128            - 'lobes'
129            - 'tissues'
130            - 'T_template0'
131            - 'T_template0_LR'
132            - 'T_template0_LobesBstem'
133            - 'T_template0_WMP'
134            - 'T_template0_Symmetric'
135            - 'T_template0_SymmetricLR'
136            - 'PPMI-3803-20120814-MRI_T1-I340756'
137            - 'simwmseg'
138            - 'simwmdisc'
139            - 'wmh_evidence'
140            - 'wm_major_tracts'
141
142    force_download: boolean
143
144    version: version of data to download (integer)
145
146    Returns
147    -------
148    string
149        filepath of selected data
150
151    Example
152    -------
153    >>> import ants
154    >>> ppmi = ants.get_ants_data('ppmi')
155    """
156    import os
157    import shutil
158    from pathlib import Path
159    import tensorflow as tf
160    DATA_PATH = os.path.join(os.path.expanduser('~'), '.antspyt1w')
161    os.makedirs(DATA_PATH, exist_ok=True)
162
163    def mv_subfolder_files(folder, verbose=False):
164        """
165        Move files from subfolders to the parent folder.
166
167        Parameters
168        ----------
169        folder : str
170            Path to the folder.
171        verbose : bool, optional
172            Print information about the files and folders being processed (default is False).
173
174        Returns
175        -------
176        None
177        """
178        import os
179        import shutil
180        for root, dirs, files in os.walk(folder):
181            if verbose:
182                print(f"Processing directory: {root}")
183                print(f"Subdirectories: {dirs}")
184                print(f"Files: {files}")
185            
186            for file in files:
187                if root != folder:
188                    if verbose:
189                        print(f"Moving file: {file} from {root} to {folder}")
190                    shutil.move(os.path.join(root, file), folder)
191            
192            for dir in dirs:
193                if root != folder:
194                    if verbose:
195                        print(f"Removing directory: {dir} from {root}")
196                    shutil.rmtree(os.path.join(root, dir))
197
198    def download_data(version):
199        url = "https://ndownloader.figshare.com/articles/14766102/versions/" + str(version)
200        target_file_name = "14766102.zip"
201        target_file_name_path = tf.keras.utils.get_file(target_file_name, url,
202            cache_subdir=DATA_PATH, extract=True)
203        os.remove(os.path.join(DATA_PATH, target_file_name))
204
205    if force_download:
206        download_data(version=version)
207
208    mv_subfolder_files( os.path.expanduser("~/.antspyt1w"), False )
209
210    # Move files from subdirectories to the main directory
211    for root, dirs, files in os.walk(DATA_PATH):
212        for file in files:
213            if root != DATA_PATH:
214                shutil.move(os.path.join(root, file), DATA_PATH)
215        for dir in dirs:
216            if root != DATA_PATH:
217                shutil.rmtree(os.path.join(root, dir))
218
219    files = []
220    for fname in os.listdir(DATA_PATH):
221        if fname.endswith(target_extension):
222            fname = os.path.join(DATA_PATH, fname)
223            files.append(fname)
224
225    if len(files) == 0:
226        download_data(version=version)
227        for fname in os.listdir(DATA_PATH):
228            if fname.endswith(target_extension):
229                fname = os.path.join(DATA_PATH, fname)
230                files.append(fname)
231
232    mv_subfolder_files( os.path.expanduser("~/.antspyt1w"), False )
233
234    if name == 'all':
235        return files
236
237    datapath = None
238
239    for fname in os.listdir(DATA_PATH):
240        mystem = Path(fname).resolve().stem
241        mystem = Path(mystem).resolve().stem
242        mystem = Path(mystem).resolve().stem
243        if name == mystem and fname.endswith(target_extension):
244            datapath = os.path.join(DATA_PATH, fname)
245
246    if datapath is None:
247        os.listdir(DATA_PATH)
248        warnings.warn("datapath in get_data is None - must be some issue in downloading the data from figshare. try calling get_data in the setup of your system.")
249    return datapath

Get ANTsPyT1w data filename

The first time this is called, it will download data to ~/.antspyt1w. After, it will just read data from disk. The ~/.antspyt1w may need to be periodically deleted in order to ensure data is current.

Arguments

name : string name of data tag to retrieve Options: - 'all' - 'dkt' - 'hemisphere' - 'lobes' - 'tissues' - 'T_template0' - 'T_template0_LR' - 'T_template0_LobesBstem' - 'T_template0_WMP' - 'T_template0_Symmetric' - 'T_template0_SymmetricLR' - 'PPMI-3803-20120814-MRI_T1-I340756' - 'simwmseg' - 'simwmdisc' - 'wmh_evidence' - 'wm_major_tracts'

force_download: boolean

version: version of data to download (integer)

Returns

string filepath of selected data

Example

>>> import ants
>>> ppmi = ants.get_ants_data('ppmi')

253    """

264            - 'lobes'

Default processing for a T1-weighted image. See README.

Arguments

x : T1-weighted neuroimage antsImage

output_prefix: string directory and prefix

labels_to_register: list of integer segmentation labels (of 1 to 6 as defined by atropos: csf, gm, wm, dgm, brainstem, cerebellum) to define the tissue types / regions of the brain to register. set to None to skip registration which will be faster but omit some results.

imgbxt : pre-existing brain extraction - a binary image - will disable some processing

img6seg: pre-existing brain segmentation - a 6-class image ( ANTs standard )

cit168 : boolean returns labels from CIT168 atlas with high-resolution registration otherwise, low-resolution regitration is used.

is_test: boolean ( parameters to run more quickly but with low quality )

atropos_prior: prior weight for atropos post-processing; set to None if you do not want to use this. will modify the CSF, GM and WM segmentation to better fit the image intensity at the resolution of the input image.

sr_model: optional will trigger sr-based upsampling in some functions.

verbose: boolean

- white_matter_hypointensity : dictionary object containing WMH results

- wm_tractsR  : white matter tracts, right
- dataframes : summary data frames
def random_basis_projection( x, template, type_of_transform='Similarity', refbases=None, nBasis=10, random_state=99): 
477def random_basis_projection( x, template,
478    type_of_transform='Similarity',
479    refbases = None,
480    nBasis=10, random_state = 99 ):
481    """
482    Produce unbiased data descriptors for a given image which can be used
483    to assist data inspection and ranking.  can be used with any image
484    brain extracted or not, any modality etc.   but we assume we can
485    meaningfully map to a template, at least with a low-dimensional
486    transformation, e.g. Translation, Rigid, Similarity.
487
488    Arguments
489    ---------
490    x : antsImage
491
492    template : antsImage reference template
493
494    type_of_transform: one of Translation, Rigid, Similarity, Affine
495
496    refbases : reference bases for outlierness calculations
497
498    nBasis : number of variables to derive
499
500    random_state : seed
501
502    Returns
503    -------
504    dataframe with projections and an outlierness estimate.
505
506    the outlierness estimate is based on a small reference dataset of young controls.
507    the user/researcher may want to use a different reference set.  see the
508    function loop_outlierness for one way to do that.
509
510    """
511    template = ants.crop_image( template )
512    template = ants.iMath( template, "Normalize" )
513    np.random.seed(int(random_state))
514    nvox = template.shape
515    # X = np.random.rand( nBasis+1, myproduct( nvox ) )
516    # u, s, randbasis = svds(X, k=nBasis)
517    # if randbasis.shape[1] != myproduct(nvox):
518    #    raise ValueError("columns in rand basis do not match the nvox product")
519
520    randbasis = np.random.randn( myproduct( nvox ), nBasis  )
521    rbpos = randbasis.copy()
522    rbpos[rbpos<0] = 0
523    norm = ants.iMath( x, "Normalize" )
524    trans = ants.registration( template, norm,
525        type_of_transform='antsRegistrationSyNQuickRepro[t]' )
526    resamp = ants.registration( template, norm,
527        type_of_transform=type_of_transform, total_sigma=0.5,
528        # aff_metric='GC',
529        random_seed=1, initial_transform=trans['fwdtransforms'][0] )['warpedmovout']
530#    mydelta = ants.from_numpy( ( resamp - template ).abs() )
531    mydelta = resamp - template
532    imat = ants.get_neighborhood_in_mask( mydelta, mydelta*0+1,[0,0,0], boundary_condition='mean' )
533    uproj = np.matmul(imat, randbasis)
534    uprojpos = np.matmul(imat, rbpos)
535    record = {}
536    uproj_counter = 0
537    for i in uproj[0]:
538        uproj_counter += 1
539        name = "RandBasisProj" + str(uproj_counter).zfill(2)
540        record[name] = i
541    uprojpos_counter = 0
542    for i in uprojpos[0]:
543        uprojpos_counter += 1
544        name = "RandBasisProjPos" + str(uprojpos_counter).zfill(2)
545        record[name] = i
546    df = pd.DataFrame(record, index=[0])
547
548    if refbases is None:
549        refbases = pd.read_csv( get_data( "reference_basis", target_extension='.csv' ) )
550    df['loop_outlier_probability'] = loop_outlierness(  df, refbases,
551        n_neighbors=refbases.shape[0] )[ refbases.shape[0] ]
552    mhdist = 0.0
553    if nBasis == 10:
554        temp = pd.concat( [ refbases, df.iloc[:,:nBasis] ], axis=0 )
555        mhdist = mahalanobis_distance( temp )['distance'][ refbases.shape[0] ]
556    df['mhdist'] = mhdist
557    df['templateL1']=mydelta.abs().mean()
558    return df

Produce unbiased data descriptors for a given image which can be used to assist data inspection and ranking. can be used with any image brain extracted or not, any modality etc. but we assume we can meaningfully map to a template, at least with a low-dimensional transformation, e.g. Translation, Rigid, Similarity.

Arguments

x : antsImage

template : antsImage reference template

type_of_transform: one of Translation, Rigid, Similarity, Affine

refbases : reference bases for outlierness calculations

nBasis : number of variables to derive

random_state : seed

Returns

dataframe with projections and an outlierness estimate.

the outlierness estimate is based on a small reference dataset of young controls. the user/researcher may want to use a different reference set. see the function loop_outlierness for one way to do that.

1066        dapper['probability_images'][1:4] = aap['probabilityimages']
